Title: P. Michaelides 2
Description: Papyrus. Demotic oracle question addressed to Teephibis. Recto: 7 lines. Verso: blank.
Curator's comments: Four very similar oracle questions from the Michaelides Collection were published by Kaplony-Heckel, Staatliche Museen zu Berlin: Forschungen und Berichte 14 (1972), pp. 79-90 and pl. 9 (= Kaplony-Heckel, Land und Leute am Nil, I, pp. 202-14). Kaplony-Heckel mentions, p. 85, that one of the other texts was closely related (same scribe, same deity etc.), but that she did not include it in her publication because its contents were unclear. This is probably this text. On the god addressed, cf. Zauzich, Enchoria 4 (1974), p. 163. Teephibis is the deity worshipped at Kasr el Aguz, but this may not be the provenance of these texts, as internal evidence from one of the oracle questions makes it likely that they come from Hermopolis.
Bibliographic references: Trismegistos / An interdisciplinary portal of papyrological and epigraphic resources (69682) (http://www.trismegistos.org/text/69682)
